name.description: The name of the package. Must start with "flipper-plugin-" prefix.

id.description: Used as the plugin native identifier and must match the mobile plugin identifier. Also shown in the Flipper main sidebar if "title" property is omitted.

flipperBundlerEntry.description: Points to the source entry point which will be used for the plugin code bundling. "flipper-pkg" takes the path specified in this property as source, transpiles and bundles it, and saves the output to the path specified in property "main".

serverAddOn.description: Path to the bundled and ready-to-execute code of the server add-on.

flipperBundlerEntryServerAddOn.description: Points to the source entry point which will be used for the server add-on code bundling. "flipper-pkg" takes the path specified in this property as source, transpiles and bundles it, and saves the output to the path specified in property "serverAddOn".

title.description: Shown in the Flipper main sidebar as the human-readable name of the plugin. If omitted, "id" is used instead.

icon.description: Determines the plugin icon which is displayed in the main sidebar. The list of available icons is static for now and can be found in https://github.com/facebook/flipper/blob/main/desktop/static/icons.json.

keywords.description: This helps people discover your package as it's listed in 'npm search'. To make the plugin discoverable in Flipper, the property must contain "flipper-plugin" keyword.

pluginType.description: Type of the plugin - "client" if the plugin connects to a specific client plugin running in a mobile app, or "device" if it connects to devices. If omitted, "client" type is assumed by default.

supportedDevices.description: List of devices supported by the plugin. The list could contain multiple devices each defined as conjunction of several properties.

items.description: Device definition. E.g. {"os": "Android", "type": "physical", "archived": false} means that plugin supports only Android physical unarchived devices.

os.description: Device OS: iOS, Android or Metro. Lack of this property means that all OSes supported.

type.description: Device type: physical or emulator or dummy. Lack of this property means it supports physical, emulator and dummy devices.

archived.description: Specifies support for archived devices. Lack of this property means that both live and archived devices supported. False means only live devices supported. True means only archived devices supported.

specs.description: Additional specs required for plugin, e.g. "KaiOS" runtime.

supportedApps.description: List of apps supported by the plugin.

items.description: App definition. E.g. {"appID": "Facebook", "os": "Android", "type": "physical"} means that plugin supports only Facebook app on Android physical devices.

appID.description: App name: Facebook, Instagram or Messenger.

os.description: Device OS: iOS, Android or Metro. Lack of this property means that all OSes supported.

type.description: Device type: physical or emulator or dummy. Lack of this property means it supports physical, emulator and dummy devices.
